articles.title: Here’s Why We Think Lionel Messi Doesn’t Deserve to Win the Ballon d’Or Despite World Cup Glory With Argentina
articles.description: Lionel Messi has reportedly won his 8th Ballon d'Or according to reports. However, there are other players who actually deserve the award.
articles.content: Soccer is a team game with trophies remaining the epitome of judgment for a player’s success. On the other hand, some fans evaluate players on their performances. Think of Zlatan Ibrahimovic as an example. He rarely won anything with his national tea... [5772 chars]

articles.title: Argentina's young electorate faces a one-in-a-generation vote
articles.description: Argentine teenager Tomas Kremenchuzky is getting ready to vote in his first ever presidential election on Oct. 22, the most open and uncertain race in his lifetime, where the frontrunner candidate is threatening to upend the country's economic model.
articles.content:
[1/3] Simon Rubinstein, 17, casts his first vote ever, in the presidential primary election, in Buenos Aires, Argentina August 13, 2023. REUTERS/Magali Druscovich Acquire Licensing Rights

articles.title: Alan Shearer makes David Beckham admission after watching Manchester United icon's documentary
articles.description: Alan Shearer was England captain when Man United's David Beckham kicked Argentina's Diego Simeone at the 1998 World Cup
articles.content:
Alan Shearer has insisted he does not blame David Beckham for England’s 1998 World Cup exit.
Manchester United legend Beckham is the subject of a popular Netflix documentary that was released nearly a fortnight ago. The documentary looks back at his ... [1940 chars]

articles.title: He Called the Pope a ‘Filthy Leftist.’ Now He Wants to Be President.
articles.description: Javier Milei is leading the race to be Argentina’s next president. But he is dogged by his past broadsides against a fellow countryman: Pope Francis.
articles.content: Javier Milei, a far-right libertarian leading the polls in Argentina’s presidential election this month, has made a lot of contentious statements in recent years: Humans did not cause climate change; people should be able to sell their organs; his na... [803 chars]

articles.title: ‘I’m unbelievably proud’: Farrell praises Ireland squad after heartbreaking Rugby World Cup exit
articles.description: Sense of a missed opportunity will linger for a long, long time as All Blacks deny the prize of a semi-final against Argentina
articles.content:
Ireland's Josh van der Flier, Johnny Sexton, Caelan Doris and Jimmy O'Brien are comforted after their defeat to the All Blacks in the Rugby World Cup quarter-final at the Stade de France. Photograph: Dan Sheridan/Inpho

articles.title: Italian priest wanted for murder and torture during Argentina's dictatorship to be extradited
articles.description: Reverend Franco Reverberi, 86, left Argentina in 2011 after the first trial for crimes against humanity carried out during the dictatorship took place - and the testimonies of survivors and family members began to point to his alleged responsibility.
articles.content:
An Italian priest sought by Argentina on charges of murder and torture during its last military dictatorship will be extradited, a lawyer has confirmed.
Reverend Franco Reverberi, 86, served as a military chaplain during Argentina's 1976-1983 militar... [1760 chars]

articles.title: Argentina’s Milei and the Dollar
articles.description: The outsider doesn’t work well with others, but he says he’ll bury the inflated peso.

articles.title: Argentina’s Cheika to use travel delay as fuel for New Zealand semi-final
articles.description: Los Pumas’ return to Paris has been delayed by a day because their hotel is not ready and Julián Montoya said: ‘It will be a short week to prepare’

articles.title: Argentina coach Michael Cheika hits out over Rugby World Cup travel delay after Wales win
articles.description: Pumas chief believes the tournament is “made for the teams in Paris” after being denied an early trip to the capital to prepare for New Zealand semi-final
articles.content:
A rgentina boss Michael Cheika has accused Rugby World Cup organisers of favouritism towards the world’s top four-ranked teams.
